Wheelchair accessibility in NYC is very bad. 

Using the subway is extremely hard. 

Sidewalks are broken, many of the curbs are so high it's impossible to on or off them, even with assistance.

Entire neighborhoods have no accessible restaurants or café's. 

Incredible.

The rate of progress in LLM optimization is just mind-blowing!  

Running 13B LLMs like LLaMA on edge devices (e.g. MacBook Pro with an M1 chip) is now almost a breeze. 

I remember when this looked like a distant future not too long ago. I feel old lol.

Asahi Shimbun ran a telephone poll asking respondents if they had hopes for PM Kishida’s plans to reverse the nation’s declining birth rate. 61% said they do not. Women were less enthused: 65% compared to 57% of men.

The Kishida gov is testing multiple plans to encourage people to have kids, including stipends to offset rising inflationary costs. The latest idea: free public school lunches, an idea endorsed by multiple political parties.
